data.title: FAITH; Ownership Signature Twice of Belle Kermit Roosevelt
data.meta_description: London, England: Duckworth & Co., 1909. 12mo, 7.3 in. x 5 in. pp. xv, 1 , 246. Signed and dated by previous owner see notes on the front free endpaper and rear pastedown. Red cloth boards with gilt title to spine. Shelfwear to edges. Corners nudged; head and tail caps of spine worn. Age-toning to pages. Good Plus. Item #87594 The book features two separate signatures of businesswoman and socialite Belle Kermit
data.text:
London, England: Duckworth & Co., 1909. 12mo, 7.3 in. x 5 in. pp. xv, [1], 246. Signed and dated by previous owner (see notes) on the front free endpaper and rear pastedown. Red cloth boards with gilt title to spine. Shelfwear to edges. Corners nudged; head and tail caps of spine worn. Age-toning to pages. Good Plus. Item #87594

The book features two separate signatures of businesswoman and socialite Belle Kermit Roosevelt, wife of Kermit Roosevelt and daughter-in-law of President Theodore Roosevelt. One signature is to the front free endpaper, dated "19, July 1918, Paris", and another is printed upside-down on the rear pastedown, dated "Paris, 1918, July 20".

Also, laid in: Signature of Kermit Roosevelt, son of Theodore Roosevelt, dated October 1918, on a single age-toned page with the printed words "Premiere Partie." Theodore Roosevelt praised Graham's work and wrote him a letter of appreciation in 1916, and Kermit considered Graham a friend, writing the introductory note to Graham's publication "Long Wolf."

Robert Bontine Cunninghame Graham (24 May 1852 â€“ 20 March 1936) was a Scottish politician, writer, journalist and adventurer. He was a Liberal Party Member of Parliament (MP); the first ever socialist member of the Parliament of the United Kingdom; a founder, and the first president, of the Scottish Labour Party; a founder of the National Party of Scotland in 1928; and the first president of the Scottish National Party in 1934. This book offers 18 short stories with setting of foreign lands.
